result.execSummary:
The defendant Dustin L Bodnar was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manufacture/Deliver Heroin (<3g), a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(d)1.
  • Manufacture/Deliver Heroin (<3g), a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(d)1.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Racine County Clerk of Circuit Court

miscConds.notes: Defendant must pay all outstanding fees and court obligations including costs of supervision during the term of probation.   If supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.

No alcohol or controlled substances except by prescription. Random UA's are authorized. Any counseling deemed appropriate by agent; specifically AODA and follow through. Must obtain and maintain full time verifiable employment or attend school full time or a combination of both equal to full time. Do not associate with any known drug users. Defendant must submit a DNA specimen, as required by law, and pay for the testing. Firearm warning given. Voting is prohibited until sentence is complete and civil rights have been restored. Defendant must obey all rules and regulations while on probation.

supervisions.notes:
**CORRECTED 10-10-2014:  Term of probation is 3 years.**

GRANTED PROBATION ON CT.1 & CT.2

Defendant Dustin L Bodnar in court with attorney Carolyn Hillery Delery.  Defendant Dustin L Bodnar in custody.  Robert S. Repischak appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Patricia Schaefer.
There are no issues with Ch. 950. Parties are in receipt of PSI. No additions or corrections to PSI by parties. Ct 1-6 yrs WPS, equal bifurcation, Ct 2- 7 yrs WPS bifurcated as 4 yrs IC, 3  yrs ES - I/S - 3 yrs prob w/approp conditions.
Defense is asking the Court to follow PSI and impose and stay a sentence and impose 5 yrs probation.

BTC:  Cts 1 & 2-sent w/held - 3 yrs prob - CFTS

Sentencing hearing on October 3, 2014 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Dustin L Bodnar in court with attorney Carolyn Hillery Delery.  Defendant Dustin L Bodnar in custody.  Sharon A. Riek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Court Reporter: Patricia Schaefer.
Plea questionnaire filed.  State's offer: Plea to 2 cts delivery of heroin.  Recommend 6 yrs (3&3) on 1 ct; 7 yrs (4&3) i/s, 3 yrs cons probation.  Balance of counts to be dismissed/read-in.
Court colloquy with defendant re rights being waived by entering plea.  Defendant indicates he understands those rights.
Court finds defendant has entered plea freely, knowingly and voluntarily.  The State consents to the jury waiver.
PLEA--guilty both counts
Finding of guilt.  PSI ordered.
  Sentencing hearing scheduled for 10-03-2014 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Dustin L Bodnar in court with attorney Carolyn H Delery.  Defendant Dustin L Bodnar in custody.  James D Newlun for SHaron Riek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Court Reporter: Pat Phinisee. Offer has been made.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for May 2, 2014 at 08:15 am.
PRETRIAL SCREENING REPORT
Preliminary hearing on April 17, 2014 at 09:00 am.

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions:  It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any controlled substances.  This is to be monitored by random UA's and/or breathalyzers.  The defendant is to report directly to Zimmerman Consulting Inc. (ZCI) for monitoring - report to 524 Main Street, Suite 302, Racine, WI  53403 (third floor of the Monument Square Building) or call (262)632-1780 to immediately schedule an appointment.   The defendant is further ordered to report for testing after each court appearance.  Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.

Defendant Dustin L Bodnar in court with attorney Carolyn H Delery.  Defendant Dustin L Bodnar in custody.  Gerad T Dougvillo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Pat Phinisee.    Reading of complaint is waived, probable cause found, bond set.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 17, 2014 at 09:00 am.
